div.p: Aurelius ...eiton, son of Pasis, from the village of Phylakitike, sitologos of the 4th indiction, to the Aurelii Souchidas and Melas, from the city of the Arsinoites, greetings. I acknowledge through this bond that I have received from you the rent for the 40 1/3 arouras that you farmed in the name of P(h)asis the boundary inspector, who has absconded, in the fourth indiction, one hundred six and a half artabas of wheat in total, which comes to 106 1/2 ar., (paid) in full, and I have no claim against you concerning any other matter ...
